code:
def convertToWords(number):
    one_words = ["", "one ", "two ", "three ", "four ", "five ", "six ", "seven ", 
                 "eight ", "nine ", "ten ", "eleven ", "twelve ", "thirteen ", "fourteen ",
                 "fifteen ", "sixteen ", "seventeen ", "eighteen ", "nineteen "]
    ten_words = ["", "", "twenty ", "thirty ", "forty ", "fifty ", "sixty ", "seventy ", "eighty ", "ninety "]
    def num_to_words(n, s):
        word_str = ""
        if n > 19:
            word_str += ten_words[(n // 10)] + one_words[(n % 10)]
        else:
            word_str += one_words[n]
        if n:
            word_str += s
        return word_str
    output_str = ""
    output_str += num_to_words((number // 10000000), "crore ")
    output_str += num_to_words(((number // 100000) % 100), "lakh ")
    output_str += num_to_words(((number // 1000) % 100), "thousand ")
    output_str += num_to_words(((number // 100) % 10), "hundred ")

    if number > 100 and number % 100:
        output_str += "and "
    
    output_str += num_to_words((number % 100), "")
    
    return output_str

#{ 
 # Driver Code Starts
#Initial Template for Python 3
if __name__ == '__main__':
    test_case = int(input())

    for _ in range(test_case):
        n = int(input())
        print(convertToWords(n))

def convertToWords(number):
    one_words = ["", "one ", "two ", "three ", "four ", "five ", "six ", "seven ", 
                 "eight ", "nine ", "ten ", "eleven ", "twelve ", "thirteen ", "fourteen ",
                 "fifteen ", "sixteen ", "seventeen ", "eighteen ", "nineteen "]
    ten_words = ["", "", "twenty ", "thirty ", "forty ", "fifty ", "sixty ", "seventy ", "eighty ", "ninety "]
    def num_to_words(n, s):
        word_str = ""
        if n > 19:
            word_str += ten_words[(n // 10)] + one_words[(n % 10)]
        else:
            word_str += one_words[n]
        if n:
            word_str += s
        return word_str
    output_str = ""
    output_str += num_to_words((number // 10000000), "crore ")
    output_str += num_to_words(((number // 100000) % 100), "lakh ")
    output_str += num_to_words(((number // 1000) % 100), "thousand ")
    output_str += num_to_words(((number // 100) % 10), "hundred ")

    if number > 100 and number % 100:
        output_str += "and "
    
    output_str += num_to_words((number % 100), "")
    
    return output_str
